title: Google\Cloud\GkeBackup\V1\BackupPlan
name: BackupPlan
description:
Defines the configuration and scheduling for a "line" of Backups.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.gkebackup.v1.BackupPlan

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Constructor.

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.name
params.description: Output only. The full name of the BackupPlan resource. Format: projects/*/locations/*/backupPlans/*

params.name: data.uid
params.description: Output only. Server generated global unique identifier of UUID format.

params.name: data.create_time
params.description: Output only. The timestamp when this BackupPlan resource was created.

params.name: data.update_time
params.description: Output only. The timestamp when this BackupPlan resource was last updated.

params.name: data.description
params.description: User specified descriptive string for this BackupPlan.

params.name: data.cluster
params.description: Required. Immutable. The source cluster from which Backups will be created via this BackupPlan. Valid formats: - projects/*/locations/*/clusters/* - projects/*/zones/*/clusters/*

params.name: data.retention_policy
params.description: RetentionPolicy governs lifecycle of Backups created under this plan.

params.name: data.labels
params.description: A set of custom labels supplied by user.

params.name: data.backup_schedule
params.description: Defines a schedule for automatic Backup creation via this BackupPlan.

params.name: data.etag
params.description: Output only. etag is used for optimistic concurrency control as a way to help prevent simultaneous updates of a backup plan from overwriting each other. It is strongly suggested that systems make use of the 'etag' in the read-modify-write cycle to perform BackupPlan updates in order to avoid race conditions: An etag is returned in the response to GetBackupPlan, and systems are expected to put that etag in the request to UpdateBackupPlan or DeleteBackupPlan to ensure that their change will be applied to the same version of the resource.

params.name: data.deactivated
params.description: This flag indicates whether this BackupPlan has been deactivated. Setting this field to True locks the BackupPlan such that no further updates will be allowed (except deletes), including the deactivated field itself. It also prevents any new Backups from being created via this BackupPlan (including scheduled Backups). Default: False

params.name: data.backup_config
params.description: Defines the configuration of Backups created via this BackupPlan.

params.name: data.protected_pod_count
params.description: Output only. The number of Kubernetes Pods backed up in the last successful Backup created via this BackupPlan.

methods.name: getEtag
methods.description:
Output only. etag is used for optimistic concurrency control as a way to help prevent simultaneous updates of a backup plan from overwriting each other.

It is strongly suggested that systems make use of the 'etag' in the read-modify-write cycle to perform BackupPlan updates in order to avoid race conditions: An etag is returned in the response to GetBackupPlan, and systems are expected to put that etag in the request to UpdateBackupPlan or DeleteBackupPlan to ensure that their change will be applied to the same version of the resource.

Generated from protobuf field string etag = 10 [(.google.api.field_behavior) = OUTPUT_ONLY];

methods.name: getDeactivated
methods.description:
This flag indicates whether this BackupPlan has been deactivated.

Setting this field to True locks the BackupPlan such that no further updates will be allowed (except deletes), including the deactivated field itself. It also prevents any new Backups from being created via this BackupPlan (including scheduled Backups). Default: False

Generated from protobuf field bool deactivated = 11;
